Type.Name: Int64Converter

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Int64Converter extends System.ComponentModel.BaseNumberConverter

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: This converter can only convert a 64-bit signed integer object to and from a string. The value type represents integers with values ranging from negative 9,223,372,036,854,775,808 through positive 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.
The method uses the method of with the integer value of .
The method uses the general ("G") format for the string returned.
For more information about type converters, see the base class and How to: Implement a Type Converter.

block.para: You should never create an instance of an . Instead, call the method of . For more information, see the examples in the base class.

summary.para: Provides a type converter to convert 64-bit signed integer objects to and from various other representations.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.
